<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/08/cancer-mortality-rates-biggest-drop-record?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pigs Fly, American Cancer Society Reports Good News
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A stethoscope and a doctor's notebook " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NTE4MTIzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most drops are bad—balls, phones, thun thuns. But today we’ve got <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/01/08/794277201/progress-on-lung-cancer-drives-historic-drop-in-u-s-cancer-death-rate?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a good drop</a> to tell you about: a big one in the cancer mortality rate. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the American Cancer Society (ACS) reported the U.S. cancer death rate fell 2.2% from 2016 to 2017, the largest single-year drop on record. The rate has declined 29% since 1991, translating to 2.9 million fewer cancer deaths than if rates stayed at their peak. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Experts pointed to two primary factors </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">First</strong>, lung cancer mortality is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/08/health/cancer-deaths-decline.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sledding down</a> an icy hill. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That’s partly because despite Phoebe Waller-Bridge’s best efforts, smoking rates are on the decline. But it’s also a result of innovations in detection and treatment, like immunotherapy and drugs that target tumors at their molecular roots. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Second</strong>, those same advancements have boosted survival rates for advanced melanoma.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Immunotherapy Yervoy and targeted agent Zelboraf </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-cancer-death-rate-drops-by-largest-amount-on-record-11578484809?mod=hp_lead_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were both</a></span><span> approved in the U.S. in 2011 to immediate effect—the one-year survival rate for metastatic melanoma jumped from 42% for patients diagnosed in 2008–2010 to 55% for those diagnosed in 2013–2015.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Valued at roughly $123 billion, the global cancer drug market is one of the largest and fastest-growing in the healthcare industry. Drugmakers like Roche (the owner of Zelboraf) and Bristol-Myers Squibb (Yervoy) <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/pfizer-pivots-to-cancer-drugs-for-growth-11548601200?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invested heavily</a> to gain a foothold in the ballooning space. We’re seeing the fruits of those investments in the ACS’s report. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">We probably should mention... </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Scientists and pharma companies haven’t beaten cancer—by a long shot. Cancer is the U.S.’ <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/01/08/cancer-death-rate-posts-biggest-one-year-drop-ever/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">second-leading </a>cause of death after heart disease. Plus, progress has slowed against colorectal, breast, and prostate cancers. And obesity-related cancer is a growing problem. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The ACS estimates that 2020 will bring about 1.8 million new U.S. cancer cases and over 600,000 deaths. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out x2: </strong>The cancer rate is measured by deaths per 100,000 people. So while the <em>rate</em> is falling, the overall <em>number </em>of cases and deaths each year isn’t.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/08/carlos-ghosn-speaks-first-time-since-escape?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fight for Your Right to Flee Japan
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Carlos Ghosn speaks in Beirut " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NTE5MDQ0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Marwan Naamani/picture alliance via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, international fugitive and besieged former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn <a href="https://apnews.com/5146c72c6ee1c9e62259436334170b81?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spoke out</a> in a press conference for the first time since he fled his Tokyo home for Lebanon. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s what a fiery, rambling Ghosn had to say: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The case against him was stacked. Ghosn said Japanese authorities pursued him in collusion with Nissan execs as part of a plot to shake him. He </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/business/live-news/carlos-ghosn-press-conference-live-updates/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">claimed</a></span><span> others at Nissan disliked his management style and vision for the company, so they conspired with prosecutors to “get rid of the guy.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What Ghosn didn’t have to say: any specifics about his <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/inside-carlos-ghosns-great-escape-a-train-planes-and-a-big-black-box-11578445084?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dramatic escape</a> inside a box used for concert gear. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tokyo prosecutors denied any collusion with Nissan and hit back at Ghosn, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/08/business/carlos-ghosn-beirut.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">saying</a> he “failed to justify his acts.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead (bear with us here)...</strong>an hour before the conference, a Lebanese prosecutor <a href="https://www.timesofisrael.com/fugitive-ex-nissan-boss-summoned-by-lebanese-prosecutor-over-israel-visit/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> Ghosn would be summoned “in the coming hours,” per the Lebanese state-run National News Agency. But that’s not related to the Japan case—it's about a 2008 visit to Israel. Israel and Lebanon are technically at war.</p>

<tr>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/08/apple-services-notches-record-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple’s Services Have “Historic” 2019
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Apple Arcade" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NTIwODYyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Apple</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple <a href="https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/01/apple-rings-in-new-era-of-services-following-landmark-year/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declaring</a> its Services business had its biggest year ever in 2019 is a little bit like saying it snowed more in December than July: No one’s particularly surprised.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the iPhone takes a step back as a senior member of Apple’s royal family, the company has rolled out a suite of software products designed to provide existing iPhone users with more, well, services. These include gaming (Arcade), subscription video (Apple TV+), finance (Apple Card), and more.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s run the numbers...<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Apple News: </strong></span><span>over 100 million monthly active users in the U.S., U.K., Australia, and Canada.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">App Store: </strong></span><span>Growth appears to be </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/07/apple-app-store-had-estimated-gross-sales-of-50-billion-in-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slowing</a></span><span>, but customers spent $386 million in the App Store on New Year’s Day 2020 alone.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Apple Card and Apple Pay: </strong></span><span>provided contactless ticket entry at more than 150 sport and entertainment venues around the world in 2019. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"></strong><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The push into Services (with a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/08/apples-story-is-shifting-thanks-to-the-massive-success-of-airpods.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big assist</a> from AirPods) has been popular with investors. Apple stock has increased <span>nearly </span>75% since June 2019, and the company is now worth more than $1.3 trillion.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fitness subscription startup ClassPass became the first unicorn of the decade after a $285 million Series E <a href="https://fortune.com/2020/01/08/classpass-unicorn-payal-kadakia/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised</a> its valuation above $1 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">ClassPass, which lets users take classes at <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/01/08/classpass-finally-a-unicorn-raises-285-million-in-new-funding/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">30,000+</a> partner studios/gyms, plans to use the money for <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-08/classpass-raises-285-million-becoming-unicorn-in-fitness-craze?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">international expansion</a> (it’s already scaled from four to 28 countries since its last fundraise 18 months ago).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> From Mirror to Peloton, fitness startups have enjoyed private investors’ mouth-foaming like a new PR. That means <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90449339/classpass-is-now-valued-at-1-billion?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">IPO hopeful</a> ClassPass faces stiff competition in an industry where most major players are flush with cash and cult followings.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But venture capital favorites haven’t impressed the public markets.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Peloton raised more than $994 million </span><span><span>in private funding </span></span><span>but its IPO last year got off to a choppy start. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>SoulCycle, coastal elites’ preferred pre-Sweetgreen workout, canceled its 2018 IPO due to "market conditions." </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What might set ClassPass apart:</strong> corporate wellness programs. Over 1,000 companies including Facebook, Google, and Morgan Stanley offer ClassPass to employees at subsidized prices.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/08/disney-selects-14-join-parks-moms-panel?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Most Magical Unpaid Internship on Earth
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Epcot " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NTE1NzQ1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Image by <a href="https://pixabay.com/users/joesandbox-3479610/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=1909805" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joesandbox</a> from <a href="https://pixabay.com/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=1909805" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pixabay</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re good at something, never do it for free. Unless you’re one of the 10,000+ Disney superfans who applied to the Disney Parks Moms Panel.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Disney <a href="https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/disney-parks-moms-panel-welcomes-14-new-members-and-launches-new-curated-content-hub-300983531.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">selected</a> the 14 adults (some moms, some dads, some childless) out of those 10,000 applicants to join its 2020 Disney Parks Moms Panel, a group of PhD-level Mouse experts who’ll spend the next year answering ~15 online questions/week about Disney park and cruise vacations.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The kicker: </strong>They won't get paid, despite being in a club more exclusive than a Tufts a cappella group. The panelists instead get a free five-night stay at a Disney park or vacation club for them and three others.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>That’s a $4,518.77 value on a moderate budget, according to </span><span><a href="https://thepointsguy.com/guide/walt-disney-world-vacation-cost/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Points Guy</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Disney’s play:</strong> <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/08/travel/disney-parks-moms-panel.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Millions of people</a> visit Walt Disney World each year, giving rise to a cottage industry of podcasts, travel agents, and more dedicated entirely to helping you milk everything you can out of that FastPass. Disney thinks it can do that better than anyone.</p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, we asked if you would rather own Snap or Twitter stock for the next three years (they currently have about the same market cap). 63% of you picked the blue bird over the white ghost. Why? </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>We asked on Twitter.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Because kids grow up” and could switch platforms—@bylouisawells</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Snap needs to “prioritize content and innovation to attract advertisers”—@nataliejharms</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1214667542343626753?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read the other responses here</a>.</p>

BREW'S BETS

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The battle of the music festivals:</strong> Bonnaroo (Manchester, TN) gave Coachella (Indio, CA) only a few days before releasing its lineup Tuesday. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Coachella:<span> </span></strong></span><span>Rage Against the Machine, Travis Scott, and—big surprise—Frank Ocean </span><span><a href="https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/rage-against-the-machine-travis-scott-frank-ocean-coachella-2020-headliners-lineup-933201/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">headlining</a></span><span>. But we’re most excited for Danny Elfman’s set, because</span><span><span> </span></span><span><em>The Simpsons</em></span><span><span> </span></span><span>theme song is an eternal bop.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bonnaroo headliners<span> </span></strong></span><span><span>include Tool, Tame Impala, and Lizzo. <a href="https://www.bonnaroo.com/lineup/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Also performing</a>: Miley Cyrus, Vampire Weekend, and Megan Thee Stallion (she'll be at both festivals). </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>So who should headline Bonnabrew? </span></p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nHEALTHCARE\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/08/cancer-mortality-rates-biggest-drop-record?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nPigs Fly, American Cancer Society Reports Good News\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A stethoscope and a doctor's notebook \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NTE4MTIzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMost drops are bad—balls, phones, thun thuns. But today we’ve got \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/01/08/794277201/progress-on-lung-cancer-drives-historic-drop-in-u-s-cancer-death-rate?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea good drop\u003c/a\u003e to tell you about: a big one in the cancer mortality rate. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the American Cancer Society (ACS) reported the U.S. cancer death rate fell 2.2% from 2016 to 2017, the largest single-year drop on record. The rate has declined 29% since 1991, translating to 2.9 million fewer cancer deaths than if rates stayed at their peak. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eExperts pointed to two primary factors \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFirst\u003c/strong\u003e, lung cancer mortality is \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/08/health/cancer-deaths-decline.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esledding down\u003c/a\u003e an icy hill. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat’s partly because despite Phoebe Waller-Bridge’s best efforts, smoking rates are on the decline. But it’s also a result of innovations in detection and treatment, like immunotherapy and drugs that target tumors at their molecular roots. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSecond\u003c/strong\u003e, those same advancements have boosted survival rates for advanced melanoma.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eImmunotherapy Yervoy and targeted agent Zelboraf \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-cancer-death-rate-drops-by-largest-amount-on-record-11578484809?mod=hp_lead_pos6\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere both\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e approved in the U.S. in 2011 to immediate effect—the one-year survival rate for metastatic melanoma jumped from 42% for patients diagnosed in 2008–2010 to 55% for those diagnosed in 2013–2015.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eValued at roughly $123 billion, the global cancer drug market is one of the largest and fastest-growing in the healthcare industry. Drugmakers like Roche (the owner of Zelboraf) and Bristol-Myers Squibb (Yervoy) \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/pfizer-pivots-to-cancer-drugs-for-growth-11548601200?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvested heavily\u003c/a\u003e to gain a foothold in the ballooning space. We’re seeing the fruits of those investments in the ACS’s report. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWe probably should mention... \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eScientists and pharma companies haven’t beaten cancer—by a long shot. Cancer is the U.S.’ \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/01/08/cancer-death-rate-posts-biggest-one-year-drop-ever/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecond-leading \u003c/a\u003ecause of death after heart disease. Plus, progress has slowed against colorectal, breast, and prostate cancers. And obesity-related cancer is a growing problem. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe ACS estimates that 2020 will bring about 1.8 million new U.S. cancer cases and over 600,000 deaths. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out x2: \u003c/strong\u003eThe cancer rate is measured by deaths per 100,000 people. So while the \u003cem\u003erate\u003c/em\u003e is falling, the overall \u003cem\u003enumber \u003c/em\u003eof cases and deaths each year isn’t.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, international fugitive and besieged former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/5146c72c6ee1c9e62259436334170b81?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espoke out\u003c/a\u003e in a press conference for the first time since he fled his Tokyo home for Lebanon. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere’s what a fiery, rambling Ghosn had to say: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe case against him was stacked. Ghosn said Japanese authorities pursued him in collusion with Nissan execs as part of a plot to shake him. He \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/business/live-news/carlos-ghosn-press-conference-live-updates/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclaimed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e others at Nissan disliked his management style and vision for the company, so they conspired with prosecutors to “get rid of the guy.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat Ghosn didn’t have to say: any specifics about his \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/inside-carlos-ghosns-great-escape-a-train-planes-and-a-big-black-box-11578445084?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edramatic escape\u003c/a\u003e inside a box used for concert gear. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTokyo prosecutors denied any collusion with Nissan and hit back at Ghosn, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/08/business/carlos-ghosn-beirut.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaying\u003c/a\u003e he “failed to justify his acts.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead (bear with us here)...\u003c/strong\u003ean hour before the conference, a Lebanese prosecutor \u003ca href=\"https://www.timesofisrael.com/fugitive-ex-nissan-boss-summoned-by-lebanese-prosecutor-over-israel-visit/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e Ghosn would be summoned “in the coming hours,” per the Lebanese state-run National #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised\u003c/a\u003e its valuation above $1 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eClassPass, which lets users take classes at \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/01/08/classpass-finally-a-unicorn-raises-285-million-in-new-funding/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e30,000+\u003c/a\u003e partner studios/gyms, plans to use the money for \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-08/classpass-raises-285-million-becoming-unicorn-in-fitness-craze?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einternational expansion\u003c/a\u003e (it’s already scaled from four to 28 countries since its last fundraise 18 months ago).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e From Mirror to Peloton, fitness startups have enjoyed private investors’ mouth-foaming like a new PR. That means \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90449339/classpass-is-now-valued-at-1-billion?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eIPO hopeful\u003c/a\u003e ClassPass faces stiff competition in an industry where most major players are flush with cash and cult followings.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut venture capital favorites haven’t impressed the public markets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePeloton raised more than $994 million \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ein private funding \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ebut its IPO last year got off to a choppy start. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSoulCycle, coastal elites’ preferred pre-Sweetgreen workout, canceled its 2018 IPO due to \"market conditions.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat might set ClassPass apart:\u003c/strong\u003e corporate wellness programs. Unless you’re one of the 10,000+ Disney superfans who applied to the Disney Parks Moms Panel.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Disney \u003ca href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/disney-parks-moms-panel-welcomes-14-new-members-and-launches-new-curated-content-hub-300983531.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eselected\u003c/a\u003e the 14 adults (some moms, some dads, some childless) out of those 10,000 applicants to join its 2020 Disney Parks Moms Panel, a group of PhD-level Mouse experts who’ll spend the next year answering ~15 online questions/week about Disney park and cruise vacations.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe kicker: \u003c/strong\u003eThey won't get paid, despite being in a club more exclusive than a Tufts a cappella group.
